Title: Football Season Ends
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at the final football game of season. After the team's victory, the band leads a crowd down streets of Lincoln in an impromptu parade.

Title: Charter Day Program
Item Description: The 31st Charter Day celebration includes performances by the Cadet Band and drill exercises by the Cadets.

Title: The Battalion
Item Description: The Cadet Band will give a concert followed by a dress parade as part of the Charter Day celebrations.

Title: University Charter Day
Item Description: Summarizes the 31st Charter Day celebration, including the Cadet Band's concert and Cadet drill performances.

Title: [Untitled]
Item Description: The authors of The Hesperian look ahead to the spring season and believe the Cadet Band's open air concerts will be in demand.

Title: Girls' Gymnasium Exhibit
Item Description: The Cadet Band accompanies a dance and gymnastics exhibition

Title: Government Inspection
Item Description: The Cadet Battalion faces inspection and review while the Cadet Band performs.

Title: Cadet Encampment
Item Description: The Cadet Battalion takes part in their annual encampment. The Cadet Band performs during a Y.M.C.A. service and weekend concerts. Includes description of encampment schedule and activities.

Title: School of Music Notes
Item Description: General updates about the School of Music, including Cadet Band director Earle Wehn's plans to teach piano.

People: Andrews, Elisha Benjamin; Barbour, Erwin H.
Title: Inaugural Ceremony
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays in the inagural exercises for Chancellor Andrews. The article includes the text of remarks by the President of the Board of Regents.

Title: Local and Personal
Item Description: The Cadet Band receives new music. Text of article: "The band has received a large assortment of new music and now some of those time-worn pieces that have awakened the echoes of the campus since time memorial, can be consigned to the waste basket"

Title: Cadet Appointments
Item Description: The Cadet Battalion receives general orders to be divided into four companies and a band. The Cadet Band drum major and officers are announced.

Title: [Untitled]
Item Description: News from the Minnesota Daily indicates that Minnesota will be sending their band to play at the Thanksgiving football game.

Title: Local and Personal
Item Description: The Cadet Band will perform at the Thanksgiving game against Minnesota, and hopes musicians will stay in Lincoln in order to compete against Minnesota's band.

Title: Final Arrangements
Item Description: The Minnesota Band of 35 members is arriving Wednesday afternoon on the train.

Subjects: Uniform & Equipment; Rehearsal; Other Band; Pregame & Halftime
Title: Local and Personal
Item Description: The Cadet Band will move from the armory to the old chapel upon completion of the new chapel. The band members receive new music. The band hopes to compare favorably to the Minnesota band during the Thanksgiving football game.

Title: Football Notes
Item Description: The Minnesota Band parades to their hotel. The Cadet and Minnesota bands perform before the football game.

Title: [Untitled]
Item Description: Dress Parade Critique. A critic tears at the University Band's dress parade performance, claiming the band must spend too much time on concert music rather than military marches.

Title: [Untitled]
Item Description: Dress Parade Critique. The critic explains that the previous editorial was meant to point out that the band performs better in concert than on dress parade and is not strictly a military band.

Title: Pass Inspection: Cadet Battalion Appears Before a Regular Officer--Showing Made Compares Favorably with the Best
Item Description: Lt. McClintock inspects the cadet battalion and band at parade grounds. The inspecting officer says the battalion would rank near the top compared with schools in seven nearby states.

Title: Rooters' Celebration
Item Description: After the football team's 6-0 defeat of Minnesota, the University Band plays at a parade and bonfire.

Title: Convocation Notes
Item Description: A listing shows songs performed by the Cadet Band during the week's convocation program.

Title: Program for this Afternoon
Item Description: The Cadet Band performs at an afternoon drill program.

Title: Fete Day Brings a Large Crowd
Item Description: A band concert and dress parade follow the Nebraska Interscholastic Meet.

Title: Cadet Band Elects Officers
Item Description: The Cadet Band president L.J. Pepperberg presides over a meeting to elect the band's leadership. The band is raising funds and performing at twice monthly "Band Informals."

Title: [Untitled]
Item Description: A Band Informal will be held Saturday night, and admission is fifty cents.

Title: Spirit Displayed
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play at a rally for the Nebraska football game

Title: Band Informal
Item Description: Advertisement for November 1903 Band Informal, Tickets 50 cents

Title: Nebraska
Item Description: Words to new song "Nebraska" by Will M. Maupin and William O'Shea

Title: Final Meeting: Mass-Meeting for Illinois Today. How Bellevue Was Swamped
Item Description: Cadet band to play at rally for Nebraska v Illinois Thanksgiving football game

Title: Campus Gleanings
Item Description: Short text update reads: L. J. Pepperberg has not been in attendance at band practice the past week on account of an attack of tonsilitis

Title: A Space Reserved: Quarters for Cadets at St. Louis If They Go
Item Description: Correspondence between Cp. Wilson Chase and E. C. Culp published about the possibility of housing the Cadets at the St. Louis Exposition

Title: Cadet Encampement Again
Item Description: The Cadets have been given 100 spots in the barracks while attending the St. Louis Exposition

Title: Further Communication
Item Description: More details about the Cadets' trip to the St. Louis Exposition

Title: The Band Concert: Cadet Band Will Give Concert February 29th
Item Description: Details about the band's upcoming Quadrennial concert. The article is complimentary of the Band's involvement with football games and its value to the university.

Title: Co. A Wins the Cup: Competitive Drill a Fine Spectacle
Item Description: The Cadet Band provides music for the Cadet's drill competition

Title: Band Concert
Item Description: An advertisement for a band concert followed by a band informal

Title: Final Arrangements: All Details of Summer Schoo [sic] Excursion Attended To
Item Description: Information for students traveling to St. Louis Exposition, mentions that band is traveling and will "wake up old Missouri"

Title: Monstrous Rally: Enthusiastic Students Make Chapel Rounds
Item Description: 1500 students gather for a rally for the upcoming Wolverines football game. The article remarks that the band "rendered noble service in adding to the noise, and if that is the only requisite for a victory in football, the Cornhuskers will have an easy time with the Wolverines."

Title: Off to Michigan: Team Leaves for Ann Arbor in Midst of Wild Cheering
Item Description: The Cadet Band and fans accompany the football team on their way to the train station, bound for Michigan.

Title: Republican Rally Program
Item Description: Program of the Republic Club meeting with music provided by the Cadet Band

Title: Meeting of Republican Club
Item Description: Cadet Band plays for Republican Club meeting in Memorial Hall.

Title: The First Band Informal
Item Description: The Cadet Band will hold the first Band Informal of the year, and is considering charging single men double because of the event's popularity.

Title: Team Looks Good: Colorado Strong on Defensive Work
Item Description: The Cadet Band will perform at a rally for the Nebraska v Colorado game.

Subjects: Cheer & Pep; Sports; Events & Dances; Fundraising & Finance
Title: Football: Nebraska vs Colorado
Item Description: The Cadet Band performs at a rally for the Nebraska v Colorado football game and advertises an upcoming Band Informal with 50-cent admission.

Title: Nebraska Wins
Item Description: The Nebraska band performs during halftime of Nebraska v Colorado game.

Title: Hold Enthusiastic Rally
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at rally before Nebraska vs. Minnesota football game. The Athletic Board had provided $150 for band to travel to game, but the amount was insufficient.

Title: Bulletin
Item Description: The Cadet Band performs at a Thanksgiving program.

Title: Football Rally
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at the year's first football rally. The article includes lyrics to football songs.

Title: The Big Rally
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a rally before football game against Drake.

Title: [Untitled]
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play at a Republican Rally in Memorial Hall.

Title: Rally for Ames
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play at the year's second football rally.

Title: A Good Meeting: Football Rally Proves Immense Success
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at football rally, and in an adjacent article, "The Prize Song," H.C. Robertson is announced as the winner of the football song contest. The band chose the contest winner.

Subjects: Cheer & Pep; Sports; Events & Dances; Politics
Title: Team Leaves Tonight: Big Send-Off Rally to be Held at the State
Item Description: The Cadet Band joins students In a send-off rally for the football team and will be performing the next night at a political debate held in Memorial Hall.

Title: Mass Meeting: Rousing Football Rally for Kansas Game this Morning
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a rally the day before the Nebraska vs. Kansas football game.

Title: A Great Rally: Biggest and Best Football Mass Meeting of the Year
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a rally for the Nebraska vs. Kansas football game. Nebraska's songs and yells are published beside the article.

Title: Band Concert
Item Description: A band concert will be held at the Oliver on April 18.

Title: Big Debate Rally: Professors, Students, and Band at Meeting
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a rally held the morning before Nebraska's debate team faces Wisconsin's.

Title: A Big Demonstration: Rousing Rally of Students for Dean Pound on Campus Tonight at 7:30
Item Description: Band, students, and staff hold a rally for Roscoe Pound, Dean Of Law School.

Title: Football Rally: First One of the Year to be Held at 11:30 Tomorrow
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play at a rally before the year's first football game.

Title: Hold Good Rally: "Thermo Pneumatics" Stir Up Enthusiasm
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a rally before the year's first football game.

Title: Band Informal
Item Description: Admission at an upcoming Band Informal is fifty cents.

Subjects: Cheer & Pep; Sports; Events & Dances; Fundraising & Finance
Title: Band Informal
Item Description: Admission at an upcoming Band Informal is fifty cents. The page also mentions a rally and the formation of a girl's rooting club and a special co-ed rooting section being reserved in the bleachers during the Colorado football game.

Title: [Untitled]
Item Description: The band will play at a Democratic Rally in Memorial Hall.

Title: Rally: Students Will See Team off to St. Louis Tuesday
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play at a rally when the Nebraska football team departs for the St. Louis game.

Title: Big Mass Meeting: Prohibition Strong with the Students
Item Description: The Cadet Band will lead a parade after a special temperance convocation. An advertisement for a University Cadet Band concert also appears on the page.

Title: Big Rally Today: Prohibition Sentiment to be Expressed
Item Description: The Cadet Band will lead a parade after a special temperance convocation. An advertisement for a University Cadet Band concert also appears on the page.

Title: The Band Complaint
Item Description: The Cadet Band complains about practice facilities in the Temple Building.

Title: Quarters Too Small: Cadet Band Petitions for a More Commodius  Room
Item Description: Band members petition for better practice facilities.

Title: Campus Gleanings
Item Description: The band will play at a rally in Memorial Hall.

Title: Given Great Ovation: Great Commoner Receives Magnificent Tribute
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at an event for presidential candidate, William Jennings Bryan.

Title: Will Run Excursion: Crowd to Go With Football Team to Minnesota
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play at a rally before the team leaves for the Nebraska Vs. Minnesota football game.

Title: Football Rally: Many Prominent Professors and Students to Speak
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a send-off rally for the Nebraska football team before the game against Michigan.

Title: Hold a Song Fest: Students Rally in Memorial Hall for Ames
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a mulitiple rallies before a football game vs the Iowa Aggies from Ames. The game will be played in Omaha.

Title: Rally Again Today: Big Time Planned for Meeting at Antelope Park
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a rally and parade in Lincoln before the Nebraska vs. Ames football game in Omaha.

Title: Grand Rally Thursday at 5: Will Be Held in Memorial Hall for Kansas Game
Item Description: The band will play at a rally for the Nebraska vs. Kansas football game.

Title: Rally for the Big Game Today: Rooters to Prepare for Kansas in Memorial Hall
Item Description: The band will play at a rally for the Nebraska vs. Kansas football game. The band will play new Jayhawker songs.

Title: Practice for Kansas: Big Rally Held in the Chapel Last Evening
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a rally, practicing songs and yells for football game against Kansas.

Title: Big Rally Tomorrow: Purpose to Arouse Enthusiasm for Kansas Meet
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play at a rally before the Nebraska vs. Kansas track meet.

Title: Already for Kansas: Cornhuskers in Good Shape for Games Tomorrow
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play at a rally before the Nebraska vs. Kansas track meet.

Title: First Rally of the Year Held This Morning
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a rally in Memorial Hall and will play in a parade in Omaha before the Nebraska vs. Minnesota football game. New songs and yells were printed in the previous day's Daily Nebraskan. (Continued from page 1)

Title: First Rally of the Year Held This Morning
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a rally in Memorial Hall and will play in a parade in Omaha before the Nebraska vs. Minnesota football game. New songs and yells were printed in the previous day's Daily Nebraskan. (Continued from on page 3)

Title: Big Parade Feature in Omaha Tomorrow: Two Thousand Lincolnites Expected to March
Item Description: The band will lead a parade In Omaha before the Nebraska vs. Minnesota football game. A special train is running from Lincoln to Omaha for the game.

Title: A Good Suggestion
Item Description: A letter to the editor suggests a scarlet and cream banner should be included in the band's halftime performances. Another article on the front page announces the second football rally, where the band will play.

Title: Big Rally Yesterday Morning: Both Men and Girls Turn Out Well to Cheer Team on to Iowa Game
Item Description: The band plays at a rally in Memorial Hall before the upcoming Nebraska vs. Iowa football game.

Title: Songs for Jayhawkers is Request of Eager: Nebraska Manager Wants to Have Good Rooting
Item Description: Students are encourage to write verses set to popular music for the upcoming football game. A "monster" rally will be held and plans are being made to meet the Kansas team at the railroad station with the cadet band leading a parade uptown.

Title: Rally for Kansas in Memorial Hall at 11: Full Hour for Giving Team Final Send Off
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play at a rally before the Nebraska vs. Kansas football game. A new song composed by Professor Stevens of the school of music will be "tried out."

Title: Rally for the Jayhawkers the Biggest in Years: More Enthusiasm Shown than Ever Before Known
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at a rally before the Nebraska vs. Kansas football game. Professor Stevens' new Scarlet and Cream song is performed.

Title: Track Team Training Hard for Omaha Meet
Item Description: The Cadet Band accompanies the University Track Team on the Rock Island for a track meet in Omaha.

Title: Team Leaves Today: Many Students and Cadet Band to Attend the Omaha Athletic Meet
Item Description: The Cadet Band accompanies the University Track Team on the Rock Island for a track meet in Omaha. The band's expenses will be paid by Omaha businessmen.

Title: Mass Meeting in the Auditorium Tonight: University Students to Gather fror "Dry" Lincoln
Item Description: Students from colleges in Lincoln will hold a rally at the city auditorium. The cadet band will perform outside the Lindell Hotel and lead a procession to the rally, where temperance speeches will be given.

Title: Football Rally Thursday 11 AM: Band to be There--Eager and Cole to Speak
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play during a rally before the upcoming Nebraska vs. Minnesota football game.

Title: Football Rally Today at 11!: Enthusiasm Running High
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play during a rally before the upcoming Nebraska vs. Minnesota football game. The words. to University yells and songs are printed on the front page, including "The Cornhusker" by Professor Stevens.

Title: Two Rallies in One Day: Students Assemble in Memorial Hall and at Depot
Item Description: The Cadet Band plays at rally in Memorial and marches to the train station before the team departs for the Nebraska vs. Minnesota football game.

Title: Plans for Monster Rally: Team Will be Given an Ovation Tuesday Morning
Item Description: The Cadet Band will play during a big rally for the upcoming Nebraska vs. Kansas football game.

People: Sherman, William Tecumseh; Webster, Isaac T.; Lincoln, Robert Todd; Board of Regents; Webster, Mrs.
Title: Our Webster: Gen. Sherman Refuses a Longer Detail
Item Description: Lt. Webster is recalled by Gen. Sherman. The article describes how he formed the Cadet Band, managed the military department, and earned the respect and loyalty of the Cadets.

Title: The Crete Contest
Item Description: The Cadet Band travels to Crete for a baseball game, accompanying a large body of students. The article describes the jocular arrival of the band, procession to the field, and chants of the fans.

People: Quick, W. T.; MacIvor, E. J.
Title: Forty-Five Band Man Selected in Tryouts
Item Description: After tryouts, the new band members and returning band members will hold their first rehearsal in the Temple with William. T. Quick, the new band director. They will play at the S.A.T.C. inauguration.

Title: Coach Kline Undisturbed by Rumors from Chicago: All Prospective S. A. T. C. Men Will be Present -- Band to Play National Airs
Item Description: The Cadet Band will perform at the inauguration of the new S. A. T. C. force. Those students who are not yet S. A. T. C. members are encouraged to attend as a duty to "show the spirit which prompts you to offer your service."

Title: Date Set for Sousa Event: Famous Music Leader Brings Band to Lincoln on November First
Item Description: The "March King" is coming to Lincoln and will give two programs

Title: Initial Rally Will be Held Friday Night
Item Description: The first football rally of the season is described, at which the band will perform

Title: Sousa Says Newspapers Furnish Best Sources of Inspiration
Item Description: Sousa believes that more than half of his marches were inspired by events he read about in newspapers, such as the inspiration for "The Liberty Bell March"

Title: Stage is Made Ready for Band: Expensive Cyclorama Placed in Coliseum Will Be Used for Sousa Concert
Item Description: A large stage fixture is being added to the Coliseum to enhance the acoustics. Additionally, lights are being installed for special effects. These will be in place in time for Sousa's visit, details of which are described in the article.

Subjects: Concert; Band Day; Other Band; Parade
Title: Sousa Will Hear Band Day Program: Twelve High School and Town Bands Will Be Entertained by University Nov. 1
Item Description: Twelve high schools will be taking part in "band day" with a parade and two performances under the baton of John Philip Sousa

Title: Kansas Band Plays Here: Kansas University Organization Will Perform at Sousa Program
Item Description: The University of Kansas band will be performing two selections with John Philip Sousa during his visit to Nebraska

Subjects: Concert; Band Day; Other Band; Parade
Title: Fifteen Bands Visit Lincoln: Over Four Hundred Musicians Will Come for "Band Day" Tuesday, Sousa Will Present Cup
Item Description: Several more high school and town bands join the ranks of those already coming to perform under John Philip Sousa. Sousa will be presenting a silver cup to the Cadet Band for their "blue star" rating the previous year.

Subjects: Concert; Other Band; Band Day; Parade
Title: Sousa's Band Plays Today in Two Concerts
Item Description: John Philip Sousa will conduct 400 students in two concerts today, after a parade through Lincoln. Sousa will also present a loving cup to the Cadet Band. Many are expected to attend the concerts.

People: Sousa, John Philip; Quick, W. T.
Title: Sousa Pleases Large Number with Program: Nearly 5000 Hear Famous Band in Afternoon and Evening Performances
Item Description: John Philip Sousa and his band performed in front of large, enthusiastic crowds. Sousa also presented William T. Quick (incorrectly identified as Herbert in the article) with a silver cup to celebrate the Cadet Band.

People: Sousa, John Philip; Burnett, E. A. (Edgar Albert); Jewett, F. F.
Title: Leader Will Compose March for Nebraska
Item Description: Upon request by the acting chancellor and Cadet commandant, John Philip Sousa agrees to write a march for the University of Nebraska

Title: Retired Major Lauds Huskers Before Cadets
Item Description: A fan gives his account of the West Point football game and the exemplary performance of the Cadet Band.

Title: Bandmen Have Varying Experiences During Two-Night Stay in New York
Item Description: An account of the Cadet Band's trip to New York for the Army vs Nebraska game and a taste of New York City's night life. The article goes into detail about the activities of specific members of the band and souvenirs they came home with.

Title: Nebraskans Looked Like Carnival Hoodlums,' Says New York Writer
Item Description: The Daily Nebraskan reports on coverage of the band by New York writers following the Cadet Band's trip to the Army vs Nebraska game. The article reacts specifically to criticism of the band's drab, military uniforms.

Title: Homecoming to be Ushered in by Rally Friday
Item Description: Homecoming rally will be moved from the Armory to the drill field due to anticipated crowd size. The band will provide music to "build up the spirit for the rally."

Title: Initial Yell-Fest at Armory Tonight
Item Description: The armory will be the site of the first rally of the year, where all students and the Cadet Band are expected to contribute their enthusiasm to assist the Nebraska football team. Lyrics to The Cornhusker are published for the convenience of rally attendees.

Title: Over 2000 Attend Dance For Students and Bankers
Item Description: The University band and Pershing Rifles perform at a Coliseum dance hosted by the State Banker's Association.

Title: Students Take Part in Parade: Cadet Band; R. O. T. C. Men Join in March on Armistice Day
Item Description: The Cadets perform in a large Armistice Day parade which began at 17th and O. The Cadet sponsors and a number of local organizations also took part in the parade.

Title: Homecoming Grid Rally is Tonight
Item Description: The band will play at the Homecoming rally Friday, following a rally the day before.

Title: Pep Session to Be Held Friday
Item Description: The University Band will play at the Friday Homecoming rally, warming the crowd up for speeches given by football coaches and members.

Title: Plan Send-Off Rally for Team: Band, Corncobs and Students Will Gather Thursday for Pep Session
Item Description: The band and Corn Cobs will rally at the train station as the football team departs for Missouri.

Title: University Has Part in Armistice Parade
Item Description: The R. O. T. C. band will participate in the Armistice Parade

Title: Rally and Torchlight Parade Tonight to Greet Notre Dame
Item Description: The band plays before the night's rally, then leads a processional from the Armory building to the Grand Hotel, to the Nebraska Buick building, to 13th and O, then to the Lincoln hotel. The freshman football team has given the drum major a new shako hat which he will be wearing.

Title: Largest Rally of Season Held Friday Evening: Torchlight Parade to Welcome Syracuse Team is Feature
Item Description: A football rally will be held in the Coloseum, transitioning to a torch-light parade to the Lincoln hotel with the university band. The rally will be broadcast over the radio.

Title: To Celebrate Oregon Game
Item Description: The University band and possibly Glee club will perform at a rally at the Armory building.

Title: Last Rally is Given to Show Husker Spirit: Crippled Team Needs Support of Students When It Faces Kansas Aggies
Item Description: The band and cheerleaders will participate in the last Friday rally of the football season.

Subjects: Uniform & Equipment; Concert; Travel; Cheer & Pep; Parade; Sports
Title: Band is Present in All Kinds of Weather at N. U.
Item Description: Writeup describing the 1928 season of the R. O. T. C. band, including their trips, rallies, concerts, radio broadcasts, and boosters. The band now has 100 members, although only 85 uniforms are available.

Title: Cadet Review is on Program Armistice Day
Item Description: The band will play "The Cornhusker" for the Armistice Day review, followed by an oath of allegiance, awards for competition, and parade.

Title: Plan Rally at Station Today for Grid Team
Item Description: The band and cheerleaders will lead a parade to the train station where the football team and cross country team are leaving for Missouri.

Title: Rally Sends Team On Way to Missouri
Item Description: The band leads a large procession of students to the train station where the football team departs for Missouri.

Title: Thousand Attend Football Rally
Item Description: The band performs at the football rally for Nebraska vs Washburn

Title: Special Train Takes Gridiron Party East
Item Description: The Cornhusker special takes the football team, band, and fans from Lincoln to New York. The band will be taken to New York City for some sightseeing prior to the game in West Point.

Title: Huge Send-Off Rally Starts Team to Army
Item Description: 2500 fans bid farewell to the football team and 50 members of the Cadet Band after a parade from the Social Sciences building through downtown to the station. The team and band will take the Cornhusker Special to West Point for a game.

Title: West Point and Studies
Item Description: Twenty five band members were unable to go to Lawrence due to academic performance, but this number was greatly improved by the time of the West Point trip. The author believes that if there were more incentives such as travel experiences, band members would be more motivated to scholastic success.

Title: Huge Crowds See Team Off for Illinois Game
Item Description: The band leads a pep rally at the Armory building before marching down O street to the train station, where 2,000 students gather to send the football team off to Illinois. Despite entreaties, the football team declines to give any speeches from the train.

Title: All Come to Rally
Item Description: Students are encouraged to attend the first of "unique" rallies at the Armory Chapel where the Cadet Band will be playing.

Title: Band Almost Sure of Trip
Item Description: The band is fundraising to pay for 40 members to travel to Notre Dame for a football game. Collection will be taken at the upcoming football game and several Lincoln businesses have made donations.

Title: Players Will Talk at Rally Friday Night
Item Description: The football team will speak at the rally before the Oklahoma game, and band will provide music.

Title: Torches, Yells, Songs Billed for Big Rally
Item Description: The band and Corncobs will lead a march from the Armory to the hotel where the Notre Dame team is staying, which the author hopes will be even larger than the massive crowd which met the team at the train station two years prior to this visit.

Title: Student Rally Is Starter to Army Contest
Item Description: The band will lead a parade from the Social Sciences building to the train depot, where they will be joining the football team on their trip to West Point.

Title: West Point Special Will Leave at 4:30
Item Description: The Football Special train will carry the football team and band to West Point, with several stops along the way. The band will have time to sightsee in New York City on Friday before the game Saturday, before returning after the game to see a musical.

Title: Dentists Take to Monkey Training to Alternate with Pulling and Grinding
Item Description: This article mentions that the efforts of fundraising for the band's trip to West Point have now been completed before describing the dental fraternity's unusual pet.

Title: Eyes of America Are On Saturday's Great Game Between Nebraska-Army
Item Description: After a large rally, the football team and band will be departing on the Cornhusker Special for West Point, where a lot is riding on the results of the Army vs Nebraska game. The band raised $5,000 in order to send 50 members to New York, where they will play to the 25,000 stadium.

Title: Elton Fee Receives Medal as Marskman
Item Description: Article describes general R. O. T. C. news, including that the band has grown in size, possibly because of the possibility of going on the West Point trip, and now has 85 active members and 99 total members.

Title: Send-Off Rally Starts Tonight at Five O'Clock
Item Description: The band will perform at a parade from Social Sciences to the stadium before the football team leaves for Ames, Iowa. The cost to attend the Iowa State game is $2.50 and the train ticket costs $9.15.

Title: Plan Rally to Give Team Big Sendoff
Item Description: The band will lead a parade from the Armory to Burlington Station to see the football team off to Illinois.

Title: R. O. T. C. Regiment Appears at Review
Item Description: The Cadets give a review, led by the band in preparation for competitions. The drill field is in poor condition.

Title: R. O. T. C. Band Makes First Official Outdoor Appearance at Cadet Parade
Item Description: The 99 member band performs at the first review of the spring. The article describes the band's additional duties, which include playing for football and basketball games, performing concert music, leading pep rallies and parades, and drilling multiple times a week.

Title: Students Give Vent to Spirit in Great Rally
Item Description: Thousands of students carrying torches, accompanied by the band, parade to the hotel where the Notre Dame team is staying to hear speeches by the Notre Dame players.

Title: Husker Rally Friday Night
Item Description: Students will gather at the Coliseum for a homecoming rally, with music provided by the R. O. T. C. band

Title: Cadets March Armistice Day
Item Description: The Cadets and band will take part in an Armistice Day parade along with local organizations. The parade route, which the Cadets will join at 17th and O, begans at 15th and N as follows: "east on N to 17th street, north on 17th to O, west on O to 9th, south of N, east on N to 13th, and south on 13th to M."

Title: Bonfire Rally on Drill Field Homecoming
Item Description: The largest bonfire in NU's history is planned after which the band will lead fans in a torchlight parade to the Lincoln Hotel to hear from the Missouri team.

Title: Students are Slow to Buy Band Tickets
Item Description: The R. O. T. C. band is not selling as many tickets for its benefit ball as they hoped, putting their trip to West Point in jeopardy. Herb Fick's Missouri Quadrangle orchestra will be playing at the ball, which Missouri football fans are also expected to attend after the game.

Title: Stage Initial Rally Tonight
Item Description: The first rally of the year will take place at 7 pm at the Armory. The band will play songs and lead an "Indian chant."

Title: Rally Friday to Prepare for Foe
Item Description: The band will perform at a rally north of the Administration building to prepare for the Syracuse game

Title: Irish Accept Invitiation to Husker Rally
Item Description: The Notre Dame football team will be attending a bonfire and torch parade, led by the band through the business district.

Title: Plan Rally for Tonight
Item Description: The band will perform at a brief homecoming bonfire and rally to prepare the football team for the Kansas game.

Title: Band Gets Seven New Instruments: Five Foot Drum, Two Lyres, Four Special Trumpets Purchased
Item Description: The R.O.T.C. band debuts new instruments at a Nebraska vs. Creighton basketball game.

Title: Strike Up the Band
Item Description: The advertisement describes upcoming band day events.

Title: Dads Tops on Campus Saturday: University Plays Host to Fathers
Item Description: High school bands will perform in a parade and pregame show during Band Day/Dad's Day celebrations.

Title: Say It With Music
Item Description: The Kansas band is praised in comparison to a lackluster Nebraska band. The band uniforms are criticized as well as its membership and spirit.

People: Oury, W. H.; Selleck, John K.
Title: Nebraska Band to Wear New, Colorful Uniforms Next Fall
Item Description: At band banquet, W.H. Oury announces the band's new scarlet and cream uniforms will replace uniforms in ROTC colors. He also discusses reorginization of the band's membership with decreased number for performances.

Subjects: Band Day; Other Band; Parade; Pregame & Halftime
Title: 27 Out State Bands Go On Parade Before Husker-Cyclone Tilt
Item Description: Ninety-six ROTC band members, wearing new uniforms will lead the parade on Band Day. The article describes the Band Day performance and songs under "Billy" Quick's leadership.

Title: "Billy" Quick Reminisces on 19 Happy Years as Band Director
Item Description: A brief article about Quick's career discusses his experience prior to and during his time leading the band.

Subjects: Band Day; Other Band; Pregame & Halftime
Title: Husker-Sooner Tilt to Feature 38 Prep Bands at Halftime
Item Description: Special performances for Band Day and Dad's Day include bands from Nebraska and Iowa communities.

Title: Features Fly, Legs Flash, Signals are Barked as Baton Boys Strut Their Stuff in Stadium
Item Description: The article discusses the role and appearance of baton twirlers and the drum major.

Title: Thousands Flood Campus for the Weekend: Rally, Presentation of Pep Queen, Dances Lend Excitement
Item Description: A rally will be held at the Union, followed by a parade and dance. The band's halftime performance at the football game will be broadcast coast to coast for the first time.

Title: Lentz Selects Band Men: Marching Tooters Drill Game-Day Formations
Item Description: Director Don Lentz announces varsity band members after tryouts.

Title: Lentz to Whittle Band to 98 Men
Item Description: Director Don Lentz is cutting varsity band from 113 to 98 members. New "West Point" style uniforms are being ordered for twirlers, and popular music will be added to the band's repetoire. An editorial above the article states the band needs improvement.

Title: Uni Rooters Stage Baylor Rally Tonight: Victory Bell Parade, Bonfire Pep Meeting Will Begin at 7 p.m.
Item Description: The band will march in a parade from the Union to the bonfire rally.

Title: Rifles Join in Pitt Rally: Drill Unit Aids Husker Pep in Panther Hunt
Item Description: In an Armistice Day ceremony, the Pershing Rifles will join the varsity band and cheerleaders in a rally and parade before the Nebraska vs. Pitt football game. Another article, "Memorial Service Precedes Game," describes a pregame ceremony to honor students killed in World War I.

Title: Corn Cobs Prepare to Increase Spirit
Item Description: University band will lead procession in the midst of several rallies before the Aggie football game.

Title: Nebraska Students Buy Kansas Tickets
Item Description: Students can purchase football tickets for the upcoming game in Manhattan, Kansas. The band will also be making the trip to play.

Title: Nebraska Squad Shows up Ames in Every Department
Item Description: The band plays at halftime during the Iowa State home game

Title: Hold Rally on Eve of Oklahoma Game
Item Description: The band plays at a rally featuring a quartet, new song, and speeches.

Title: Students Plan Send-Off for Team Thursday
Item Description: The band will play at the Armory before a parade to the Burlington Station, where the football team is leaving for Illinois.

Title: Huskers Meet for Big Rally
Item Description: 1,500 students take part in a rally before the Illinois game. The band led the students in song.

Title: Hartley Will Talk at Rally
Item Description: Former Husker captain speaks at Armory rally. The band will be traveling to Notre Dame for the game.

Title: Plan Send-Off for Cornhuskers
Item Description: The band will lead a crowd in songs as the football team leaves from the train station at 9th and S streets. This follows a rally the previous day.

Title: Party Ticket Sale Is Well Under Way
Item Description: Tickets are being sold for the Homecoming R. O. T. C. Band Ball as a fundraiser for the band to travel to West Point. Downtown businesses are supporting the fundraiser. Herb Fick and his Missouri Quadrangle Colleagians will provide music for the dance.

Title: Giant Rally to be Held Friday Night
Item Description: The band will lead a parade on the eve of Homecoming to the Lincoln hotel where the Missouri football team is staying.

Title: Rally for First Home Game Will Be Held Tonight
Item Description: The band will play at an Armory rally for the Oklahoma game.

Title: Gamma Lambda Elects
Item Description: Elections are held for the honorary band fraternity, Gamma Lambda's, membership. The organization plans to add several more college bands as chapters.

Title: Train Arrival Starts Rally in Manhattan
Item Description: A rally is planned in Manhattan, Kansas, when the train carrying the football team, cheerleaders, band, and fans arrives. They will parade from the downtown district to Gillette hotel, where the football team is staying.

Title: Special from Kansas Coming
Item Description: University of Kansas students are on their way to Lincoln, bringing with them the 92 person band.

Title: K. U. Athletic Director Will Talk At Rally
Item Description: The band will perform at the Homecoming rally, where several members of the University of Kansas's athletic department will be speaking.

Title: Freshmen Lay Plans for Football Rally
Item Description: A freshman rally is being organized at the Armory for the freshmen football team's Missouri game. The band will be performing.

People: Quick, W. T.; Pauley, Carroll R.
Title: U.P. Announces $2.75 Rate for Manhattan Trip
Item Description: The Union Pacific is offering a round trip price of $2.75 for the Scarlet and Cream special to Manhattan, Kansas. The band will be traveling on the special to the game.

Title: Grid-Graph to Help Organize Cheer Section
Item Description: A new device powered by electricity will be used in Lincoln to indicate the position of the football and players in Illinois. The band will be performing at the "Grid-Graph Party" at the Armory.

Title: Cornhuskers Off to Meet Illini Team
Item Description: The band and Innocents leads a four block parade to send the football team off to Illinois.

Title: Student Rally Will Welcome Players Home
Item Description: The football team and band return from West Point at the Burlington depot, where they will be greeted by the student body.

Title: Gigantic Rally Holds Sway at Station Tonight
Item Description: The band will lead a parade from Social Sciences to the Rock Island Station at 20th and O to welcome back the football team from Syracuse.

Title: Dance Ticket Sale is Large
Item Description: The R. O. T. C. band benefit tickets are selling well, and entertainment and food have been arranged for the event. The University of New York football team will be in attendance. The band will perform at the west entrance of the Social Science building to raise awareness and sell additional tickets.

Title: Coaches and Athletes Endorse Sending Band to Seattle Game
Item Description: The student body and football team supports sending part of the band to Seattle for the game on Thanksgiving day. The band will be sponsoring a benefit dance in order to fundraise for this travel.

Title: Last Rally of Year is Friday
Item Description: A torchlight parade will end the football rally season, as the band and cheerleaders lead from the Social Science building to the Hotel Cornhusker.

Title: University Band Will Play at Convocation
Item Description: The band gives its first concert of the season at the Temple for convocation.  The article goes on to mention the success that band alumni have enjoyed playing with orchestras regionally and nationally.

Subjects: Events & Dances; Fundraising & Finance; Uniform & Equipment
Title: Benefit Mixer for Band Huge Success
Item Description: A benefit is held for the band, with music by Leo Beck's orchestra. The band will soon receive new uniforms, modeled after the R. O. T. C. officer uniforms.

Title: Two Thousand Attend Rally
Item Description: The band plays "Cornhusker" at the opening Armory rally of the year, attended by 2,000 students. Freshmen are encouraged to trade their high school sweaters for Nebraska gear.

Title: Rally Planned for Dads and Visitors
Item Description: A parade is planned through downtown Lincoln as a part of the "noise party." Any "visiting Dad" is invited.

Title: Delt-Phi Delt Bell Formerly Reposed in Belfry Tower of Seward Church
Item Description: Research reveals that during their annual summer retreat in 1898, Cadet members stole a bell from a Black church, which has since been passed between fraternity houses.

Title: To Hold Track Rally Tonight
Item Description: The band will play at a rally for the varsity track squad, although there will be no parade.

Title: "700 to Ames" is Aim of Corncobs
Item Description: The Corncobs are selling tickets for a special to Ames for $10.70. The band will be accompanying the football team to Iowa.

Title: Send-Off Rally Scheduled for This Afternoon
Item Description: The band will perform at a rally sending the football team to Pittsburgh. Students will parade from Social Sciences to the Burlington Station.

Title: Plans Started for Breaking of Stadium Ground
Item Description: The band will be performing at a ceremony for the stadium's ground breaking. Many alumni will be present.

Title: Initial Rally for Freshmen to Come Today
Item Description: The band will play for the freshman class's convocation.

Title: Fight for U-N-I' is Theme from New Husker Melody
Item Description: The band will play the new song "Fight Nebraska" by Joyce Ayres and Lamar Burling. The song will be distributed to students so that they might memorize the lyrics for football season.

Title: Students Will Vent Ardor at Monster Rally
Item Description: The band will perform at a Coliseum rally for the Montana game.

Title: Band Plays at Coliseum Today
Item Description: The band and Glee Club will give a concert, free to the public.

Title: Will Hold Rally for Team Today
Item Description: The band will lead a parade at the first rally of the year. They begin at the Armory and travel to the Burlington Station to send off the football team for Illinois.

Title: Send-Off Rally Will Be Friday
Item Description: The band will lead a parade from the Armory to the North-western Depot, where the football players will be leaving for St. Louis.

Title: Rally Starts Team on Way to Pittsburgh
Item Description: The band leads a parade from Social Sciences to 16th and R, then down O to the station to send the foorball team to Chicago.

Subjects: Uniform & Equipment; Audition; Drill; Military; Rehearsal
Title: Initial Drill Reveals Difficulties of Playing in University Cadet Band
Item Description: This article details the beginning stages of this year's cadet band, where 14 new freshmen and sophomores are learning the ropes. The Cadet rules have changed and freshmen must still attend drill for their first semester. The band will add belts and pouches to their uniform.

Title: Rally Friday at Station to Send Team Off
Item Description: The band will lead a rally from The Armory to the station for the football team's trip to St. Louis

Title: Two Color Slings for Flag Bearers
Item Description: The military department will use two new slings to display flags during regimental parades.

Title: Busses Will Go to Missouri U
Item Description: The band may possibly be traveling in a convoy of 20 buses bound for Missouri. Round trip tickets cost $12.

Title: Ames Tickets Go On Sale Monday
Item Description: The band will be traveling to Ames, Iowa. The roundtrip price for the special is $10.70.

People: Burnett, E. A. (Edgar Albert); Avery, Samuel;
Title: Cadet Regiment Is Given Oath of Allegiance
Item Description: 2,000 cadets swear allegiance to the flag. The band performs "The Cornhusker" after the ceremony.

Title: Freshmen Convocation Launched This Morning
Item Description: The freshman class will be iniated in the Armory, with accompaniment from the band.

Title: Annual Barbecue Staged on Field of New Stadium
Item Description: Memorial Stadium hosts a freshman barbecue, at which the band led the new students in chants and cheers.

Subjects: Cheer & Pep; Homecoming; Parade; Other Band
Title: Seating Capacity for Homecoming is Large
Item Description: The dedication of Memorial Stadium and homecoming celebration can host 20,000. The band will lead a large parade from 12th and R to the stadium, followed by the R. O. T. C., U of Kansas Band, and various fans and colleges.

Title: Make Plans for Rally Tonight on Drill Field
Item Description: The band will perform at a rally just north of the Social Sciences building before the Kansas game.

Title: R. O. T. C. Regiment Will March Friday
Item Description: The band and R. O. T. C. will march in the Armistice Day Parade throughout the downtown district until a service is held at St. Paul Church.

Title: Large Rally is Planned for Tonight
Item Description: The band and Corn Cobs will lead a procession from the Coliseum to the Lincoln hotel in advance of the Syracuse game.

Title: Children Enjoy Concerts Given by R.O.T.C. Band Three Times Weekly
Item Description: The band rehearses three times a week at the drill field between 12th and 14th streets. Children frequent these rehearsals, watching, dancing, and imitating the band members.

Title: Band Present at Rally and Game
Item Description: The band will perform in a parade before the Drake game, as well as take part in halftime entertainment. For the first time this year, the band performs the Star Spangled Banner and all members will wear uniforms. In the past, the band has not been able to provide uniforms for all members.

Title: Season's First Rally Proves Big Success
Item Description: The band takes part in the first rally of the year.

Title: New Nebraska Songs
Item Description: Students are encouraged to take the songs "Win! Nebraska!" and "N E B R A S K A" to the evening's rally.

Title: First Outdoor Rally Will be Held Tonight
Item Description: The band will take part in a rally at the Social Sciences building the evening before the Missouri game. On Thursday, the band played at a football practice.

Title: Band Working on Special Exhibition for Husker-Tiger Game Saturday
Item Description: Following the performance of the Drake University band, and given that the R. O. T. C. Band will have the opportunity of performing at halftime, the band is working on special drill. The article has a description of the drill formations, including an N for Nebraska and M for Missouri.

Title: [Untitled]
Item Description: E. A. Wyman is elected drum-sergeant after Cecil Matthews's employment at the Lyric theater interferes with his duties.

Title: Plans Complete for Big Send-Off
Item Description: The band will lead a parade from 12th and R to the Burlington Depot to send the football team to play Notre Dame.

Title: Uni Band Plays at Legion Convention
Item Description: 60 members of the band perform at the American Legion convention in Omaha.

Title: Husker Team Leaves Today for Missouri
Item Description: The band will perform at a mid-day rally for the football team's send off from Burlington Station bound for Missouri.

Title: Grid-Graph in Operation for Illinois Game
Item Description: The game will be broadcast in the Armory via a "grid-graph scoreboard." The band and cheerleaders will perform to accompany the watch party.

Title: Armory to Q Station for Rally
Item Description: The band will lead a parade from the Armory to Burlington Station, where the football team is leaving for Illinois.

Title: Band will go to Notre Dame
Item Description: The band will travel to Notre Dame and to Kansas. A fundraising effort is underway and students are encouraged to contribute for the band's trip. Band members are also asked to fund a portion of the travel expenses.

Title: Football Team Goes to Kansas
Item Description: The university band will travel with the football team to Kansas.

Title: University Band Will Go on Friday Special to Help Trim Jayhawkers
Item Description: 40 bandmembers will travel to Kansas out of the 72 total members after auditions.

Title: Tassels Will Sell Feathers for Band
Item Description: The Tassels are selling scarlet and white "N" feathers for $.25 to raise money for the band's capes and caps. The band will premiere an arrangement of a new Husker pep song.

Title: Rally and Torchlight Parade in Preparation for Gridiron Classic to be Novel Affair
Item Description: The band will lead chants and songs followed by a torchlight parade down 12th to Q, to 16th, to O, then to the Lincoln Hotel at 9th street to greet the Notre Dame team.

Title: Basketball Rally to be Held Friday Morning
Item Description: The band will perform at the Armory to celebrate the basketball team's opening game.

Title: Band Tryouts Will be Conducted Soon
Item Description: The date for band auditions will be announced soon

Title: Need Instructors
Item Description: Advertisement for band and orchestra instructors

Title: Rockne Expects Bitter Contest
Item Description: Notre Dame is predicting a difficult game against the Huskers. The band is expected to play for the Nebraska team's send-off.

Title: Mamouth [Mammoth] Parade for Grid Men's Sendoff
Item Description: The university band will lead an expected 4,000 students to send the football team to the Notre Dame game. The parade will start at 12th and R to O before heading to the Burlington Depot.

Title: Big Parade for Foot-ball Team
Item Description: The article reports on a 2,000 student parade led by the band to send the footbal team to Pittsburgh. The parade wound through Lincoln, from the Armory to 12th and O, to 9th, then to P and the Burlington Station.

Title: Good Program Scheduled for Opening Rally
Item Description: The band will perform at the first football rally of the season. The article impresses upon new students the importance of the rally as "one of the oldest and most important of the Cornhusker traditions."

Title: Nebraska Gridsters Ready for Coyotes
Item Description: The band will perform at the football game against the South Dakota Coyotes.

Subjects: Fundraising & Finance; Events & Dances; Uniform & Equipment; Audition; Drill
Title: Band Mixer Comes Tomorrow Night
Item Description: The band is holding a dance to fundraise for new uniforms. Leo Beck's orchestra will provide music at the Armory event. The article includes updates about the band's auditions and rehearsals, as the band will be learning new songs this year.

Title: All Bandmen
Item Description: All band members who are not registered this semester are asked to return uniforms and books immediately.

Title: Band Men
Item Description: A note for band members to appear in the regimental parade in uniform

Title: Splendid Showing is Made by R.O.T.C. Unit
Item Description: The band performed in a parade and inspection in honor of General Pershing's visit in April. The R.O.T.C. will perform several more parades and reviews the rest of the semester.

Title: Yearlings to Attend First Convocation
Item Description: The freshmen class will attend a convocation in the Armory at which there will be speeches and music performed by the band and Varsity Quartet. The band will also perform outside of the Armory in advance of the convocation.

Title: Will Dedicate New Stadium Next Saturday
Item Description: Memorial Stadium's dedication will be held next Saturday. The band will lead a parade through downtown Lincoln and then enter the stadium for a dedicatory program. Participants include the R.O.T.C., Kansas University band, Kansas fans, and Nebraska staff and students.

Title: Nebraska Makes First Entry on New Page in Her Athletic History
Item Description: The first football game is played in Memorial Stadium, at which the band performs songs such as "There'll Be a Hot Time in the Old Town Tonight."

Title: Sale of Tickets for Ames Starts Monday
Item Description: Tickets are sale for a trip to Ames, Iowa for $11.12. The band and Corncobs will be accompanying the football team to the game.

Title: Bizad Students to Hold Annual Holiday Friday
Item Description: The band will lead a march to celebrate the agriculture campus's holiday, which includes a picnic, baseball game, dinner, and dance.

Title: To Use Fusees for Torches in Parade Friday
Item Description: Students will use railroad fusees (flare light) in a torchlite parade around the business section of Lincoln. The band will perform before the rally.

Title: University Band Picks Cheyney as President
Item Description: The results of the University Band officer elections are published, along with the date of the band banquet.

Title: Uni Band Entertained at Lions Club Banquet
Item Description: The band are guests at the Lions Club at the Lincoln Chamber of Commerce.

Title: Mounted Troops and Air Squadron from Fort Riley Kansas, Will Feature Military Carnival on May 23
Item Description: The band and cadet regiment will take part in a military exhibition at the state fair grounds. Fifty thousand spectators are expected to attend the event, which will include many troops, airplanes, cavalry, and artillery. Visiting military groups and bands will parade through downtown Lincoln before arriving at the fairgrounds.

Title: Military Units Now Completed: R. O. T. C. is Ready for Today's Event
Item Description: Classes will be dismissed early in advance of a large military exhibition at the State Fair Grounds. The R.O.T.C. band will perform a concert.

Title: Football Rally Staged Tonight
Item Description: The 60 person band will perform at the first rally of the year for the Illinois footblal game.

Title: Song and Yell Rallies Held Yesterday
Item Description: The band performs at multiple rallies between classes, with more to follow today.

Title: Nebraska and Illinois Will Clash Tomorrow
Item Description: The band performs at rallies held between classes in advance of the Nebraska v Illinois game.

Title: Finish Plans for Luncheon
Item Description: The band will perform at the women's Cornhusker Luncheon during a short program at the Armory.

Title: Rally Will be Held Outdoors
Item Description: The band will perform at a rally  and parade in advance of the Colgate game. The parade will move from around 12th and R to the Post Office Square and Lincoln Hotel.

Title: Tag Day
Item Description: This notice contains instructions for students fundraising for the band to return their tags to the Social Sciences building today. A banner at the top of the page reads "SEND THE BAND TO NOTRE DAME!"

Title: Band Will Go to Notre Dame
Item Description: Despite a student fundraising drive falling short, the Lincoln business community has promised funding for 40 members of the band to travel to the Notre Dame game.

Title: Major Assigns Cadet Officers
Item Description: Additional cadet officers are assigned to the band.

Title: Hartley Will Talk at Rally
Item Description: A rally will be held for the football team leaving for Notre Dame. The band will also be traveling to the game.

Title: Plan Send-Off for Cornhuskers
Item Description: The band will lead cheers at a rally for the football team leaving for Notre Dame. The rally will take place at the Chicago & Northwestern railway station at 9th and S.
